system.description:
For some, the line between battle and dance is blurred to the point of nonexistence.  Whether in one on one duels or on the battlefield, they glide across their chosen arena with a grace that can only be called dance, even by those on the receiving end of its wrath.  You gain the following benefits:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to your choice of your Dexterity or Charisma score, to a maximum value of 20.
  • You gain one of the adept's dance Focus Features, and treat your adept level as your adept+bard level for the purpose of qualifying for dances or Focus Features that require dances.
  • As a bonus action, you may expend 2 exertion to enter a War Dance.  You cannot enter a war dance if you are wearing armor or using a shield.  A War Dance lasts for 1 minute and ends early if you are incapacitated or your movement speed is reduced to 0.  While in a War Dance you gain the following benefits:
    • Your AC is equal to 10+your dexterity modifier+your wisdom modifier+your charisma modifier.
    • You may start an adept dance as part of the same bonus action you use to start your war dance, spending exertion as normal.  When starting your War Dance or while it is ongoing the exertion cost of any adept dances or any Focus Features that require dances are reduced by 1.
    • When you fail a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, you may use your reaction to spend 1 exertion point to make a Performance(charisma) check, applying the dance specialty of you have it, and replacing the result of your save if it is higher.
